subject: Physical Fitness
title: Reward Substitution
description: A quick, practical guide to Reward Substitution.

hook.text: Exercise benefits are long-term. But your brain wants rewards now. This mismatch explains why starting is so hard.

discovery.text: Reward substitution adds an immediate reward to the behavior: a podcast only during cardio, a treat after the gym.

twist.text: The artificial reward bridges the gap until the natural reward â€” feeling great from exercise â€” takes over.

climax.text: Eventually, the exercise itself becomes the reward. But until then, temptation bundling keeps you showing up.

punchline.text: Pair hard things with fun things. The bridge carries you until habits form.

quiz.question: What is temptation bundling in the context of exercise?
options: Pairing an enjoyable activity with exercise to create an immediate reward
Bundling multiple exercises into one session
Avoiding all rewards until goals are reached
